summary: Winnipeg is the biggest city in the Canadian province of Manitoba. It's named after Lake Winnipeg, which means "muddy water" in the Cree language. People have traded there for a long time, even before Europeans arrived. French traders built the first fort in 1738. The city is known for its extreme weather, with very cold winters and warm summers. Winnipeg is an important transportation hub and has a diverse economy. It hosts many fun festivals and has several professional sports teams.
title: Winnipeg
